I learnt about incentives, systems and institutions, why things are the way they are, and how change can happen. I learnt to be more balanced and pragmatic, and I learnt not to jump to conclusions. I met a lot of inspiring people, and learnt to appreciate great work. My experience at FDR was a huge turning point in my life. This is where I discovered what I wanted to do with my life, and got the confidence that maybe, I can do it. I continue to be associated with FDR and Dr JP.

Got the opportunity to spend some time in the New York and London offices, hence got a chance to work and learn from diverse teams. I learnt about finance, markets, collaborating well with people outside your team in getting things done, and what it feels like to work with a great manager. But perhaps most importantly, I learnt about what is meaningful to me - and came to the conclusion that whatever work I do, I would like to create a positive meaningful impact in somebody's life.

work_experience.title: Founder and CEO
work_experience.description:
WHAT WE DO
We help you (B2B consultant or agency owner) build an effective client acquisition system and stop depending on referrals.

HOW DO WE DO IT
We promote the principle "Sales Before Marketing"
Sales = Interrupting someone and asking for their business.
Marketing = becoming known, liked and trusted (via content). 
Sales comes first.
Marketing (i.e. content) serves as Sales Enablement. 
It's there for the person you reached out to - they should see your business has a pulse and that you know your stuff.

WHAT MOST B2B SERVICE PROVIDERS GET WRONG
1) They depend on their network and referrals. Because of that...
--> 2) They don't specialize enough. Revenue uncertainty leads to accepting too many different deals. Because of that...
--> 3) They don't create conveyor-belt style service delivery. Everything they sell is a custom-tailored suit. Because of that...
--> 4) They cannot delegate or automate. Everything depends on the founder. Because of that...
--> 5) They don't have enough time to think strategically and systemically
--> back to 1)

So far, EVERY single client of ours who consistently applied our methodology had at least 300% ROI. That's why we say: If you don't make your money back with our systems in the first 6 months of working with us, we'll refund you.

KNOW MORE? 
Learn more & book a call at www.alphaleadacademy.com

profile.headline: Identity Innovator | Cloud Alchemist @ Radiant Logic
profile.bio:
As a passionate Cloud Engineer with 8+ years of experience, I thrive on solving complex challenges and optimizing cloud infrastructures. My journey began with a fascination for technology and a desire to harness the cloud's power to drive business innovation.

Throughout my career, I've spearheaded multiple cloud migration projects, slashing operational costs by 30% and enhancing system reliability for Fortune 500 companies. My expertise in AWS and Azure, coupled with proficiency in Terraform and Kubernetes, enables me to architect scalable, secure cloud solutions tailored to diverse business needs

Key Achievements:
 Led a team to implement a cloud-native architecture, boosting application performance by 50% while ensuring industry compliance
 Orchestrated a seamless migration of 100+ legacy applications to a hybrid cloud environment, resulting in a 40% reduction in infrastructure costs and 99.99% uptime
 Designed and implemented a robust disaster recovery solution, reducing Recovery Time Objective (RTO) from 24 hours to 2 hours

I'm driven by the ever-evolving nature of cloud technology and its potential to revolutionize businesses. My approach combines technical acumen with strategic thinking, allowing me to bridge the gap between complex cloud solutions and tangible business outcomes.

Specialties:
 Cloud Platforms: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud
 Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, CloudFormation
 Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes
 CI/CD: Jenkins, GitLab CI
 Scripting: Python, Bash
 Monitoring: Prometheus, Grafana
 Security: IAM, VPCs, Security Groups

Beyond technical skills, I'm a strong advocate for knowledge sharing and team collaboration. I regularly contribute to open-source projects and mentor aspiring cloud professionals, believing that collective growth strengthens our entire industry.

When not immersed in cloud architectures, I'm an avid hiker and amateur photographer, finding inspiration in nature's intricate systems  much like the complex cloud ecosystems we build.

I'm always eager to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, potential collaborators, or anyone interested in discussing cloud strategies. Whether you're looking to optimize your cloud infrastructure, explore emerging technologies, or simply chat about the future of cloud computing, I'd love to hear from you

work_experience.title: Data Scientist
work_experience.description:
As a Cloud Solutions Engineer, my responsibilities pivoted around cutting-edge cloud technologies and DevOps methodologies. I've collaborated with skilled teams to leverage AWS, Azure, and GCP, along with tools like Kubernetes and Terraform, demonstrating proficiency in cloud-native architecture and microservices.

During this role, I worked extensively with Kubernetes, deploying microservices on Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS). This approach allowed for the seamless scaling and management of applications, showcasing the power of containerization in a cloud environment.

Security and network configuration were also a significant part of my role. I created Security Groups, Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs), and Load Balancers across different services and regions within AWS. The use of Terraform templates further streamlined this process, enabling me to deploy resources across multiple cloud providers efficiently.

As part of an organizational drive towards continuous integration and deployment, I created pipelines using GitHub and GitLab/Jenkins. This allowed me to deploy multiple test and UAT environments for various teams, ensuring the consistency and reliability of our software releases.

Throughout my role, I conducted data extraction, data manipulation, and developed predictive models using Python and R for our internal teams. This aspect involved rigorous troubleshooting of production issues by navigating multiple log files and creating runbooks to check for any failures in the pipelines.

Simultaneously, I installed and implemented new programs, modules, servers, hardware, and network equipment to improve resources or increase compatibility. Throughout this journey, DevOps practices were critical to enhancing collaborative efforts, infrastructure management, and maintaining an agile workflow. In essence, my role integrated the power of cloud-native technologies and the efficiency of DevOps in realizing business objectives.

Dr. Aasit Shah
MD, eQuinoxx House of Art  Design  Films

Aasit Shah is a multi-faceted personality who has been felicitated by several global and Indian universities, media houses and organizations owing to his leadership skills and creative vision. Hailed as the Creative Icon of India, his efforts made an instrumental impact on the growth of Art & Design industry in India.

An alumnus of University of Southern California, he is an esteemed Silicon Valley veteran who has worked with Adobe Systems & eBay before returning to India with a plan to revolutionize the creative industry. Honored with an Honorary Doctorate by the University of Azteca in Los Angeles, Aasit is the brainchild and creative force behind eQuinoxx, the leading design hub in the country.

Holding important executive board positions in Gujarat Chamber of Commerce (GCCI) and JITO, he has been awarded among Men of the Year by Times Group in 2018 & 2019 along with several prestigious recognitions, over the years. His knowledge and stronghold over creative aspects nurture his enigmatic personality, driving creativity across the eQuinoxx Group.

For his dynamic vision & immense expertise in the field of Art-Design-Films, Aasit was conferred with Estrellas Award by Divya Bhaskar Group in 2018. Also featured on the Cover Page of a popular international magazine - SiliconIndia in 2018. Earlier he was awarded by Times of India as Icon of Gujarat in 2017 & by Divya Bhaskar in 2012 as the Young Turk/GenNext Entrepreneur of Gujarat for his business-ideas & being an inspiration for the new age.

Featured on Radio on MYFMs My Icon Show as well as interviewed by Gujarat TV, Mantavya News, Ahmedabad Times, Economic Times, City Bhaskar as well as Mumbai Mirror publications.

Hes also been invited by Nirma School of Management, Adani Institute of Infrastructure Management, United World Business School, Ahmedabad University, GLS School of Management, B.K School of Management, DPS School & Gujarat Technological University (GTU) for Keynote talks on Entrepreneurship, Branding-Marketing & as a Jury for judging various Competitions.

Felicitated by Honorable PM Shri Narendra Modi, Gujarat Chief Minister Shri Bhupendrabhai Patel & past Chief Minister Shri Vijaybhai Rupani, Gujarat Education Minister Shri Bhupendra Sinh Chudasma, Gujarat Energy Minister Shri Saurabh Patel, Ahmedabad Commissioner of Police Shri A. profile.name: Abhishek Upperwal
profile.headline: Building foundation language models for Indian languages | Founder at Soket Labs | IISc Bangalore
profile.bio:
Entrepreneur during the day, Engineer at night.

Abhishek is a Data Scientist by profession and CEO by the needs with a total of 8+ years of experience in various roles. His personal vision is to advance the field of AI that can ultimately contribute towards solutions for social issues. This is reflected in the vision of his startup, Soket Labs.

He started his professional life as a freelance web developer, which transitioned into a design studio startup. He has done his post-graduation in Computational and Data Sciences from Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, specialising in High-Performance Computing and Distributed Systems. 

He has work experience in various big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Giraph, and various distributed systems or Blockchain technologies like Ethereum and Libp2p. 

He has also been engaged with the smart cities mission initially as a fellow for building a DataSpace for smart cities to streamline their data management capabilities through data processing pipelines and creating data standards for urban mobility. He has worked with the Data and Management Unit as a Data Scientist to support various data initiatives in the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs and National Institute of Urban Affairs. He co-lead the Wastewater Intelligence Network Program which aims to institutionalise Wastewater-based Epidemiology for healthcare surveillance and use of data for decision making in pandemic management.

work_experience.title: CEO / Founder
work_experience.description:
Soket Labs is an AI research firm with a vision to further the advancement in AI towards ethical AGI. 

We are building a modular GenAI platform designed to accelerate model development and deployment, ensure scalability, enhance team efficiency, and mitigate ethical and operational risks in AI applications. 

The stack will be utilised to train a multilingual foundation model, embedding global knowledge with balanced representation of major Indian languages.

work_experience.title: Co-Lead, Wastewater Intelligence Network
work_experience.description: Wastewater Intelligence Network Programme aims to strenghten healthcare surveillance through the use of Wastewater-based Epidemiology. WIN is currently deployed in Surat to track the presence of SARS-CoV-2 virus in different catchment areas. We collect wastewater samples from STPs and manholes and test it using RT-PCR to estimate the viral load in the population of the catchment.

profile.headline:
all things content and audience | 
ex-head of FilterCopy
profile.bio:
I love using audience insights, data and creativity to shape narratives and behaviors. And I've spend the last decade doing exactly that - not just by creating content, but by building organic distribution, systems, communities, teams, and the content thesis behind it. 

I started at a digital agency in 2015 when brands were just waking up to social media. I gained early exposure to digital platforms, audience behavior and metrics and very quickly, found merit in working on content that found its own audience, without marketing spends. 

I joined Pocket Aces in 2017 (FilterCopy, Dice Media, Gobble, Nutshell) as a founding member and set up and scaled branded content from scratch - before it became a buzzword :) I then went on to lead Content Strategy across our fiction and non-fiction channels. 

Eventually, I headed FilterCopy, one of Indias most loved youth content platforms, scaling it to 3B+ annual organic views and a 20M+ audience across YouTube, Instagram, Facebook and Snapchat, organically and profitably, with a team I am still proud of! 

I've produced 15+ high-retention IPs (social and OTT), content amassing 10B+ organic views, worked with 300+ brands - guiding them not just on what content to make, but how to measure the real impact of storytelling, beyond views.

I am always looking for more ways to bring the audience to the right content! Love talking all things audience, platforms, communities, Kdramas and content :)

profile.name: Harsh Meel
profile.headline: Engineering Solutions for the Climate Challenge | Researching Geoengineering & Clean Energy Grid @ Cornell | Cornell MS'26 | IIT Bombay '23 | FSAE
profile.bio: Hey, I am a graduate researcher at Cornell, passionate about leveraging engineering and computational tools to tackle the climate challenge of this century. My work spans geoengineering and renewable energy grid modeling I am currently researching Stratospheric Aerosol Injection in the Climate Engineering group and clean energy grid optimization for New York State in the Anderson Lab. In effect, a clean grid helps prevent a climate emergency, while geoengineering explores last-resort solutions to stabilize Earth's climate if we fall short. I started out in hardware prototyping and design with Formula Student, but over time, my focus shifted toward computational modeling, optimization, and climate science. This blend of hands-on and analytical experience helps me approach problems from both a technical and systems-level perspective. Im currently looking for internship opportunities in places where I can grow and apply my skills in modeling, optimization, energy systems and climate dynamics to real-world climate challenges. Check out my academic website to learn more about my work! https://harshmeel.github.io/

profile.name: Sipra Roy Halteman
profile.headline: Growth & Marketing Leader | Working Mom
profile.bio:
Im a marketing leader with 17+ years of experience helping brands growfrom early-stage startups to Fortune 500sacross the U.S., Europe, and Asia.

Ive led global teams, launched performance marketing strategies, built brands from scratch, and helped high-growth companies scale from early-stage to eight-figure revenue with clarity and intention.

But what truly drives me is the why behind the work: building meaningful things with good peopleand creating impact that lasts beyond the campaign.

I come from an immigrant family and stepped into a leadership role early in life. That shaped how I show up today: with grit, creativity, and a deep sense of ownershipin work and in life.

Professionally, I care deeply about:
 Growth strategy thats both creative and data-driven
 Leading with clarity, calm, and care
 Building strong, resilient teams that do work theyre proud of

Personally, Ive learned the power of sharing whats realespecially the harder parts.
If anything Ive experienced can help someone else feel less alone, more seen, or more supported in their own journey Im here for that too.

Im not here to be perfectjust real.
And if what I share helps even one person grow, thats enough for me.

Additional:
Fluent in Spanish, conversational in Bengali.
Relevant international experience in the U.S., Europe, and Asia.

profile.name: Esper Chawah
profile.headline: Certified Training Manager/Director
profile.bio:
Currently as a Training & Certification consultant with decades of experience in the field, I help organizations build high-stakes, legally defensible certification programs that align with their business objectives and customer needs. I provide consulting services and guidance on best-practices and processes, such as role definition, job task analysis, blueprinting, item writing, analysis and monitoring.

Previously, I was a Certification Program Manager at Cloudera, where I redesigned and relaunched the Cloudera Certification Program (CDP) for cloud and data professionals. I developed and documented exam development processes ensuring reliability, validity, and legal defensibility. I designed and developed four exams in one year, covering different roles and technologies. I also have experience as a Director of Customer Training at Vena Solutions, where I led a team that delivered high-quality, instructor-led and eLearning programs with high learner satisfaction. I updated the curriculum strategy to create more efficient, role-based learner paths, and implemented a standardized training delivery methodology for increased consistency.

I am certified as a Training Manager/Director by Langevin Learning Services, and I am pursuing a BEd in Adult and Continuing Education and Teaching from Brock University. I have strong skills in customer relationship management, people management, training and development, certification and accreditation program management, curriculum design, strategic planning, needs analysis, and adult learning principles. I am passionate about creating and delivering impactful learning and certification solutions that enable learners to achieve their goals and advance their careers.

profile.name: Snehanshu Saha
profile.headline: Professor, Dept. of CSIS, BITS Goa and Head-Anuradha and Prashanth Palakurthi Centre for Artificial Intelligence Research (APPCAIR-All Campuses of BITS Pilani), Head-IKA (All Campuses of BITS Pilani); F-IETE
profile.bio:
I focus on developing a strong theory group on Machine learning and Deep Learning, specifically addressing the complex issue of optimization in Learning and attempting to unfold the black-box deep learning techniques. I develop methods in Computational Learning Theory (COLT) and Mathematics of Data Science (MDS) Techniques and focus on building Pointwise smooth approximations of gradient, discovering activation functions from data, smoothness and convexity studies of loss functions, methods in interpretable deep learning, novel loss functions in back-propagation, Chaos-causality in Deep Neural Networks and pruning/compression in Deep Networks. My Goals include Efficient, reliable and robust Inferences (One Landscape) via tools such as Measure Theory, Non-Linear Optimization, Functional Analysis, Econometrics and Dynamical Systems. I apply the methods to solve problems in Biology, Healthcare, AstroInformatics (AIM), Transportation, and other Social good applications (AML).
Recent Notable Publications (2022-23):
1. N.Arya, A. Mathur, Sriparna Saha, S.Saha; Improving the Robustness and Stability of a Machine Learning Model for Breast Cancer Prognosis through the use of Multi-Modal Classifiers; Scientific
Reports (Nature) [Q1, I.F: 5]
2. N.Arya, A. Mathur, S.Saha, Sriparna Saha; Proposal of SVM Utility Kernel for Breast Cancer Survival Estimation; IEEE/ACM Transactions on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics [Q1, I.F: 3.74]
3. J.Sarkar. S.Saha, S.Sarkar; Efficient Anomaly Identification in Temporal and Non-Temporal Industrial Data using Tree Based Approaches; Applied Intelligence [Q1, I.F: 5.4]
4. Aishwarya. M, V.Raychoudhury, S. Saha, S.Kar, Anusha. K, CARE-Share: A Cooperative and Adaptive Ride Strategy for Distributed Taxi Ride Sharing, IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems [Q1, I.F: 9.98]
5. A. Tambewkar, A. Maiya, Soma.S. Dhavala and S.Saha; Estimation and Applications of Quantiles in Deep Binary Classification; IEEE Transactions on Artificial Intelligence
6. Tejas Prashanth, Snehanshu Saha, Sumedh Basarkod, Suraj Aralihalli, Soma S Dhavala, Sriparna Saha, and Raviprasad Aduri; LipGene: Lipschitz continuity guided adaptive learning rates for fast convergence on Microarray Expression Data Sets [Q1, I.F: 3.74]
7. Rohan Mohapatra, Snehanshu Saha, Carlos A. Coello Coello, Anwesh Bhattacharya, Soma S. Dhavala and Sriparna Saha; AdaSwarm: Augmenting gradient-based optimizers in Deep Learning with Swarm Intelligence, the IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computational Intelligence [Q1, I.F: 4.9]

work_experience.title: Professor
work_experience.description:
At RPI, as a tenured, Full Professor, Shiv's work was primarily in the area of computer networking, concentrated around the theme of traffic management and high performance wireless networking. With his collaborators and students, he has made contributions to topics such as congestion control, reliability, connectionless traffic engineering, quality of service (QoS), last-mile community wireless networks, low-cost free-space-optical networks, automated network management using online simulation, multicast, multimedia networking (including peer-to-peer multimedia systems), and performance analysis. His special interest was in developing interdisciplinary connections between network architecture and fields like control theory, economics, scalable simulation technologies, video compression and optoelectronics.

At RPI he was affiliated with the Networking Laboratory, Center for Pervasive Computing and Networking (CPCN), and the Center for Image Processing Research (CIPR) at ECSE. His former student colleagues (list dated). The team's external sponsors at RPI included DARPA-ITO , NSF , ARO, AT&T Labs Research , Intel Corp. (Research Council and IXA Program), MIT Lincoln Labs (AFOSR subcontract) , and WIMAX Forum . His team and research was supported by IBM Corp. (IBM SUR Program) , Qwest Communications Inc., Packeteer Inc., Nortel Networks (University Research Program) , Reuters Inc. , and Pulsecom Inc . He has also worked closely with international standards bodies like WIMAX Forum , IETF , the ATM Forum and several industrial friends including Cisco, Lucent, Nokia, Sprint, Starburst, Tellabs and Torrent (Ericsson).

Best known as the originator of the 4th Industrial Revolution and the digital themes of today.

Named the 'most influential futurist of our century, igniting two global themes' by CNBC. Acknowledged as 'the most influential management thinker of our times' by Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, the ruler of Dubai, and recipient of the prestigious Knowledge Award for Intellectual Achievement and Knowledge Sharing, often referred to as the Nobel Laureate of Knowledge.

education.activities: Received a full scholarship for the program.
education.description:
Instructor(s): Maryn McKenna
Produced in collaboration with the W.H.O., UNESCO and UNDP, this course helped journalists to improve their coverage of the pandemic. This self-directed course uses the content from the Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas massive open online course (MOOC) titled Journalism in a pandemic: Covering COVID-19 now and in the future. The four-week course took placed from May 4 to May 31, 2020.
Divided into four weekly modules, the online course will notably cover the past history of pandemics and disasters in the 20th century and how governments responded to these outbreaks. It will also examine the unfolding of the 2020 pandemic and the fundamental importance of fostering freedom of expression, as well as detecting and combating disinformation and misinformation about the pandemic.

profile.name: Prashant Bohra
profile.headline: Founder and CEO | Start-up Mentor and Advisor| Angel Investor | JITO-JITEM National Convenor| JITO-JIIF Member| GTM Strategist, Health and HealthTech Consultant.
profile.bio:
With over 25 years of experience in the health and pharmaceutical industries, I have honed my skills in strategic initiatives, P&L management, and digital marketing. Currently, I lead Strategic and Business Development Initiatives at BJW Health Private Limited, focusing on P&L management and driving innovation in healthcare delivery. My expertise lies in building profitable and sustainable businesses, planning go-to-market (GTM) strategies and executing brand-building strategies and digital marketing campaigns that yield measurable success.

Professional Journey
My career began in the pharmaceutical sector, where I developed a strong foundation in sales, marketing, and networking. Over the years, I have successfully built, developed, and executed numerous brand-building strategies and digital marketing campaigns, consistently delivering measurable results. My ability to leverage digital platforms has been instrumental in enhancing patient care and provider outreach.

At BJW Health Private Limited, we have developed two patented and innovative brands that address key challenges in controlling infections in hospital setups.

Reliance Retail's Netmeds: Partnered with Netmeds to apply my competencies in digital and performance marketing, optimizing market presence and driving substantial growth. Developed Customer Lifecycle Management (CLM) initiatives to build long-term associations, impacting success and stickiness. Our collaborative efforts have positioned us at the forefront of digital marketing in the healthcare and e-commerce segments.

Marketing Consultant: Proven track record in the pharmaceutical and healthcare sectors, leading to company growth and building P&L profitability through sales drivers, strategic initiatives, and digital campaigns that yield measurable success.

Skills and Expertise
- Sustainable and Growth Orientation
- P&L Management
- Driving ROI and Business Impact
- Strategic Initiatives
- Brand-Building Strategies
- Digital Marketing Campaigns

Industry Experience
- Health and Hygiene
- E-Commerce
- Digital Healthcare Solutions

Dedication to Excellence
I am mentor and Advisor to incubation centers, guiding young minds with GTM strategies, networking, and industry connections. With a dedication to excellence and a forward-thinking approach, I am committed to driving growth and innovation in the health sector. My passion for leveraging business growth to build a strong ecosystem has been a cornerstone of my career. I am always seeking new opportunities to collaborate and make a positive impact in the industry.

profile.name: Ravneet Punia

profile.bio: Tech Enthusiast with great interest in learning new stuff.

work_experience.title: CTO & Co-Founder
work_experience.description:
About TranslateMe Network: TranslateMe Network is an innovative ecosystem where users contribute data through a Telegram-based app in exchange for crypto tokens. The platform empowers human language experts to help create datasets, and the revenue generated from selling AI models trained on this data is redistributed back to the community. This approach allows for the development of AI models in various languages, while creating sustainable income streams for contributors.

Key Achievements:
* Led a 32-member team to develop the platform, enabling users to share personal data (text and audio) for AI model training in exchange for crypto tokens.
Scaled the Android app user base from 5,000 to 1M, establishing a community of 9,000+ language experts who contribute to the creation of high-quality datasets and AI models.

* Developed language models in 41 languages using Python, PyTorch, AWS, and FastAPI, achieving top-tier accuracy for African languages, and serving 1,000 SMBs.

* Built partnerships with Binance, Coinbase, and other crypto exchanges to list TMN Coin for public trading, and secured listings with financial portals like Yahoo Finance and CoinMarketCap.

* Spearheaded JarvisCalling.ai, a new vertical leveraging AI-driven conversational models to enhance sales, marketing, and customer support efficiencies for businesses of all sizes.

work_experience.title: Advisory Member & Consultant
work_experience.description:
About Hearing Aid Labs: Hearing Aid Labs is South Africas largest audiology retail chain, with 24 stores offering a range of advanced hearing aid devices and diagnostic services. The company specializes in high-tech hearing aids, including rechargeable hearing aids and Bluetooth-enabled hearing devices that improve accessibility and hearing quality for patients.

Key Achievements:

* Integrated an advanced AI model to analyze 50,000 monthly customer interactions, enhancing sales and marketing strategies across all 24 stores.

* Assisted in reducing marketing expenditures while maintaining patient treatment volumes, ensuring financial stability amidst post-COVID-19 challenges.

* Enhanced customer support efficiency by integrating AI, reducing response times, improving overall patient satisfaction, and leading to an increase in Net Promoter Score (NPS).

work_experience.title: Data Scientist
work_experience.description:
As part of Samsungs Wearables Sensor Management Team, I was responsible for developing cutting-edge features on Samsung Galaxy Watches, leveraging AI to enhance the user experience. Below are two key projects I contributed to:

Project 1: Auto Cycling Detection

* Developed a solution for auto-detection of outdoor cycling activity using motion sensor data on Samsung Galaxy Watches.
* Led a team of 80 engineers, overseeing the development of AI models that accurately detect cycling activities.
* Personally handled data collection, on-device deployment, and rigorous testing to ensure over 90% accuracy for the Samsung Galaxy Watch 5 series.

Project 2: Auto Dynamic Workout Detection

* Spearheaded the development of a model for detecting non-periodic, high-intensity motion activities such as Badminton, Table Tennis, Squash, and gym exercises.
* Replaced the existing machine learning model with a neural network based on statistical and Fourier features, achieving 91% accuracy. The model was successfully commercialized in the Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 series.

Key Achievements:

* Coordinated a team of 80 engineers and led 100+ volunteers to test AI models with ride-hailing companies like OLA and UBER, ensuring real-world validation before commercial release.
* Awarded the prestigious Shining Star Award for successfully developing and deploying AI models on Samsung Galaxy Watch 4, 5, 6, and 7 Series, with over 600 million watches in the market.
* The Dynamic Workout Detection feature became the 2nd most used feature in the Galaxy Watch 4 series.

Tech Stack: Python, Numpy, Pandas, TensorFlow

work_experience.title: Student Mentor
work_experience.description:
Mentored two projects for CDLI as part of their NLP for rare language mission.

 Project 1: 
The project aims to build an end-to-end NMT Pipeline while making use of the extensive monolingual Sumerian Data.
For complete details and source code, please check: https://github.com/cdli-gh/Semi-Supervised-NMT-for-Sumerian-English


Project 2:
The project aims to translate and provide detailed information(POS tagging, Named Entity Recognition, English Translation) about 1.5M Raw Sumerian Text.

For details and source code, please check: https://github.com/cdli-gh/Sumerian-Translation-Pipeline

A combined research paper was published at the ACL SRW conference, one of the world's more renowned conferences for NLP.

work_experience.title: Student Developer
work_experience.description:
The project aims to build and train a neural network-based encode-decoder architecture for Sumerian-English  (Language used around 4,000 years ago) Machine Translation to support experts in cuneiform studies with automated translations.

Experimented with multiple encoder-decoder type architectures,  finally achieved a BLEU score of 21.6 using a custom build transformers architecture.

Project Overview: https://summerofcode.withgoogle.com/archive/2019/projects/5914126327480320
Source Code: https://github.com/cdli-gh/Machine-Translation

work_experience.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant | University of Oxford, Toronto, Goethe - Frankfurt
work_experience.description:
During my undergraduate studies at Delhi Technological University (DTU), I developed a strong foundation in Artificial Intelligence (AI), focusing on computer vision and natural language processing (NLP). Under the mentorship of Professors N.S. Raghava, R. Rohilla, and Dr. Minni Jain, I contributed to several high-impact research projects.

As a Research Assistant, I had the privilege of working on collaborative projects with the University of Toronto, Goethe University Frankfurt, and later the University of Oxford. My focus was on extremely low-resource languages like Sumerian, which fueled my passion for advancing NLP. Additionally, my research in computer vision and radiology for COVID-19 detection was published at international conferences like IEEE and INCET.

Key Contributions:

* Published multiple research papers on AI in computer vision and NLP, with work showcased at prestigious conferences like IEEE, ACL, and ICON.

* Collaborated with the University of Oxford, University of Toronto, and Goethe University Frankfurt as an Undergraduate Research Assistant, focusing on NLP and low-resource languages.

* Participated in Google Summer of Code 2019, working on NLP projects related to machine translation for low-resource languages.

Publications:

1. "Computer Vision and Radiology for COVID-19 Detection" - IEEE, 2020
2. "Neural Machine Translation for Tamil to English" - Journal of Statistics and Management Systems, 2022
3. "How Low is Too Low? A Computational Perspective on Extremely Low-Resource Languages" - ACL, 2021
4. "Towards the First Machine Translation System for Sumerian Transliterations" - COLING, 2020
5. "Improving Neural Machine Translation for Sanskrit-English" - ICON, 2020
6. "Computer Vision Approach for COVID-19 Detection" - ICMISC, 2021
7. "Towards the Law Enforcement of Firearms" - IEEE INDICON, 2020

profile.name: Bob Guarasci

profile.bio: In 1994, I asked my colleague Rob Long to join me in creating a new community development organization in the city of Paterson, New Jersey.  We started that year with an AmeriCorps national service program and now serve more than 4,000 children and families each day through services that include several school-based Teen Centers, a youth center, a preschool, after-school programs, a charter school, and a number of other initiatives.  We have also developed more than 200 units of affordable housing and built a number of community spaces, a dozen playgrounds, and our most recent program is a city-wide Financial Empowerment Center operated in partnership with the City of Paterson.  Along the way, we've rehabilitated a number of 100+ year-old buildings where we carry out our work, embracing the importance of historic preservation.
